Star

class gyrelc.Star(**kwargs)

Takes path to mesa model specifying stellar parameters necessary for plotting a light curve.

Parameters

  • mesa_model (str, optional) – Path to MESA stellar model, defaults to None if blank or if model type is a point mass

  • gyre_model (str, optional) – Path to GYRE tides model, defaults to zero tides if blank or if model type is a point mass

:param synspec_modelPath to SYNSPEC atmospheric spectrum model,

defaults to using MSG for spectra as desired

Parameters

  • mass (float, optional) – Stellar mass is specified by user if model type is a point mass, else is auto-set according to mesa_model

  • radius (float, optional) – Stellar radius can be specified by user if model type is a point mass, else is auto-set according to mesa_model

  • luminosity (float, optional) – Bolometric luminosity can be specified by user if model type is a point mass, else is auto-set according to mesa_model

  • Teff (float, optional) – Effective temperature can be specified by user if neither mesa_model or synspec_model are specified and MSG spectra are desired

  • logg (float, optional) – Effective surface gravity can be specified by user if neither mesa_model or synspec_model are specified and MSG spectra are desired

  • units (str, default='SOLAR') – User may choose between ‘CGS’ and ‘SOLAR’

__init__(**kwargs)

Constructor method

make_pt_mass_response()

Makes a zero-response for the point mass.

read_mesa_params(mesa_model_path)

Reads and builds stellar parameters from user-specified MESA model. Converts to solar units assuming MESA output is CGS.

read_phot_coeffs(filter_x, synspec_model=None)
read_phot_coeffs_h5(filter_x, synspec_model)

This function is old and was tested on a synspec intensity spectrum calculated from iOri’s tlusty atmosphere.

read_pt_mass_params()

Checks for user-specified point mass parameters. Does unit conversions as needed.
